summary: Game 1 of a 30-days/30-games challenge: build 'Neon Tic-Tac-Toe' as a full-stack Tic-Tac-Toe DApp with neon dark-mode UI, unbeatable MiniMax AI, sound effects, reset, and an ICP-backed global leaderboard by username (most wins).
architectural_notes: App is a full-stack DApp with an ICP backend used for persisting global leaderboard data.
Consider optimizing MiniMax for responsiveness (e.g., alpha-beta pruning/memoization) and optionally add a brief intentional UI 'thinking' delay/animation to keep gameplay feeling smooth.
known_issues: AI move computation can feel slow ('AI is thinking…' delay), especially early in the game.

existing_features.title: Create the Neon Tic-Tac-Toe game UI in dark mode using Tailwind CSS with a consistent neon aesthetic (neon blue and neon pink borders/accents), including a 3x3 board, current turn/status text, and clear end-of-game messaging (win/lose/draw).
Implement Tic-Tac-Toe gameplay for Human vs. AI, where the human plays first and the AI uses the MiniMax algorithm to be unbeatable.
Add a Reset button that restarts the current game to the initial empty board state and resets any in-game status (turn, outcome).
Add sound effects for gameplay interactions: play a click sound when the human places a mark, and distinct sounds for game end states (win/lose/draw).

Add a username flow in the UI and integrate it with the leaderboard: allow the player to set/enter a username, record a win to the backend when the human wins, and display the global leaderboard (Most Wins by username).

Reduce the perceived and actual AI response time after the player places an X by replacing the current fixed 500ms AI delay with an adjustable “AI Speed” setting (speed steps) that controls the AI move delay while keeping the gameplay smooth.
Optimize the Tic-Tac-Toe AI move computation so the AI remains unbeatable but selects moves faster in the browser, especially early in the game (reduce the time spent in MiniMax).
Make the AI-turn UX feel smoother by ensuring status transitions (e.g., 'AI is thinking…' -> 'Your Turn (X)') update consistently with the AI speed setting, without flicker or long blocking frames.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create Neon Tic-Tac-Toe full-stack DApp (Game 1) with dark mode neon Tailwind UI
Implement Tic-Tac-Toe gameplay: human vs unbeatable MiniMax AI
Add a Reset button to restart the game
Implement global leaderboard stored on ICP backend showing 'Most Wins' by username
Implement an ICP-backed global leaderboard that tracks 'Most Wins' by username: persist wins in the Motoko backend and expose query/update methods to record a win and fetch a sorted leaderboard.
Improve AI turn responsiveness: optimize MiniMax so AI plays very fast after user taps X, while keeping gameplay smooth (optionally with a short intentional/animated 'thinking' delay).
